newsitem.title: INDIA: Indian parliament adjourns until Friday.
newsitem.headline: Indian parliament adjourns until Friday.

text.p: India's parliament has adjourned until Friday following a row over political developments in the western state of Gujarat, officials said on Wednesday.
The adjournment forced Finance Minister P. Chidambaram to postpone a planned statement on his 1996/97 (April-March) budget proposals, which had been expected on Wednesday.

The Hindu nationalist Bharatiya Janata Party (BJP), the main opposition party in parliament, stalled morning proceedings in both houses because of what it said were attempts to dislodge the BJP-led local government in Gujarat.
Parliament will be closed on Thursday because of the Hindu festival of Janmashthami, officials said.
